Title: Mechanical Engineer - St. John's, NL - Indeed.com
Description:
Company Description
Founded in 1934, Parker Drilling provides advanced drilling solutions to the energy industry. We are a technically innovative company providing worldwide drilling services, rental tools and project management, including rig design, construction and operations management.
Job Description
This position takes total ownership of projects as assigned by providing mechanical support and expertise. Support includes, but is not limited to, engineering, design, upgrades, rig modifications, and equipment specifications.
Essential functions
Demonstrates proactive and positive client engagement.
Interface with existing and new customers and vendors.
Provide requested updates in a timely manner to all functional groups within the Parker Drilling Canada location.
Review engineering and design documentation.
Create document(s) to support Technical Service Requests (TSR's) and other projects.
Review and comment on engineering and design document(s) for Technical Service Requests (TSR's) and projects.
Support project controls related to engineering.
Support engineering design of existing equipment modification projects and new items as per request from Operations.
Familiar with 3D Modelling and Drafting as required on a project by project basis
Writing technical specifications and procedures.
Maintain and retain complete and accurate business records in accordance with company policies and relevant external audit bodies, as required
Ongoing commissioning and troubleshooting support for rig upgrade projects.
Performs additional duties, responsibilities, and special projects as may be directed.
Additional functions
N/A
Qualifications
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or abilities expected for this position.
Must be able to prioritize jobs and work under tight time constraints.
Must have excellent computer skills to include all MS Office products, analytical software, and computer-aided software
Must be able to find solutions to business problems through Operations and Quality initiatives
Must be able to effectively interface with other departments and divisions to resolve problems
Must have ability to maintain high standards of confidentiality, accuracy and timeliness
Must be a detail oriented, self-starter and able to work with little supervision while maintaining quality
Must possess sound reasoning skills and have the ability to follow directions
Must have the ability to travel to company locations including offshore and remote locations
The ability to read, write, and speak English is required
Knowledge of engineering deliverables such as datasheets, material specifications, material requisitions, scope of work, and data registers.
Proficient drilling knowledge related to drilling equipment, structures, well control, and process/utility systems.
Additional qualifications, skills and abilities
o Candidates require a degree in Engineering from a recognized post-secondary institution. o Must be registered, or eligible for registration, with the Professional Engineers & Geoscientists of Newfoundland and Labrador o At least 10 years of work experience in the oil and gas industry o Must be able to obtain appropriate offshore certifications:  Basic Survival Training (BST)  Hydrogen Sulphide (H2S)  Installation Safety Induction  Regulatory Awareness  Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS) The employee will be required to meet all standards required for safe operations, including but not limited to the standards set forth in the Canadian Association of Petroleum Producers Atlantic Canada Medical Assessment for Fitness to Work Offshore as well as any other standards set forth by regulatory bodies having jurisdiction over the operations.
Position competencies
Intercultural Awareness
Understands, leverages and respects cultural differences, languages, customs and manners on the ground. Has the ability to be flexible, adaptable and agile in foreign environments.
Business Acumen
Business Acumen is understanding how our businesses generate profits and competitive advantage after weighing foreseeable risks. It requires knowledge of how technical and functional roles contribute to and impact bottom-line results. Specifically, it's knowing what business, financial and operational conditions must exist for Parker to maximize profits, without undue risk. Business acumen requires savviness of market practices and industry tactics to assess and determine when the outcome of a decision will result in added value for the organization.
Building Effective Teams
Promotes followership; encourages team members to share knowledge; values contributions of all teammates; shares wins and successes; creates positive morale and spirit.
Physical demands and work environment
Oversee and manage the overall quality of projects and/or employee performance.
Ability to gather, analyze, and interpret data.
Lift, carry, and move objects of up to 50 pounds.
N/A - Not Applicable
Wear personal protective equipment, including but not limited to hard hat, steel-toed safety shoes, hearing protection, respirators, safety glasses, goggles and full body harness.
Ability to ascend and descend ladders, stairs, scaffolding, and/or ramps while carrying tools requiring a reasonable degree of physical stamina and agility and involving moderate to severe physical exertion
Ability to multitask, work in a fast-paced environment, meet deadlines, reason logically, and make sound decisions.
Ability to comprehend, remember, and follow verbal and written directions and comply with Company policies, procedures and standard.
Sit/stand while performing primarily sedentary work
Use repetitive wrist, hand or finger movements at a computer.
Ability to work as a team, communicate and interact with others in a professional manner, and consider alternative and diverse perspectives.
Additional Information
Consistent with the Accords Act, residents of Newfoundland and Labrador specifically and Canada generally, who are qualified, will be given first consideration for employment.
Parker Drilling provides equal opportunity for all people and will not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, gender, sexual orientation, pregnancy, age, marital status, national origin, citizenship status, disability, genetic information, military service, veteran’s status or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.
If an applicant has a disability, the applicant may request accommodations when needed to enable that person to perform their essential job functions or to allow that person to participate in employment.

Title: Metrology Engineer - Engineer, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Metalock’s Metrology department uses Laser Tracker, Probing/Scan Arms and 3D Scanners to provide a range of services all over the world from small sub contract measurement to large scale precision engineering projects.
Role
As a Metrology Engineer within Metalock you will be expected to lead large scale machining projects from a dimensional and quality aspect. Projects are heavily dependent on the metrology engineer to ensure all work carried out is correct and completed in a timely manner.

Title: Ingénieur en génie industriel - Drummondville, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
Poste offert chez Soucy Caoutchouc - Drummondville
CE QUI T’ATTEND
Tu auras à travailler en équipe multidisciplinaire sur des mandats variés touchant le génie industriel tel que l'optimisation des processus. Ta contribution permettra d'améliorer la performance générale de l'entreprise.
En résumé, voici ce que tu feras de ton temps :
Contribuer aux améliorations sur le procédé de fabrication afin d’atteindre les objectifs qualités de production
Analyser les techniques et méthodes de travail relatives à la fabrication
Établir et réviser les cadences de production lors des soumissions, lors de la mise en production ainsi que lors de tout changement
Mener des projets d’amélioration continue en élaborant et en optimisant les procédures dans l’entreprise
Établir des mesures de performance et contribuer à l’atteinte des objectifs
Participer au montage des tableaux de bord dans les différents secteurs
Participer aux développements stratégiques et identifier des opportunités d’amélioration en proposant des idées adaptées à notre réalité industrielle
Définir et optimiser les aménagements d’usine et des cellules de travail
CE QU’ON RECHERCHE
Baccalauréat en génie industriel
0 à 3 ans d'expérience dans des fonctions similaires
Expérience dans le domaine du caoutchouc (un atout important)
Bonne maîtrise du français (parlé et écrit)
Maîtrise de la suite Microsoft Office (avancée en Word et Excel)
Bonne capacité d’analyse de données
Bonnes connaissances des concepts et outils LEAN
Rigueur dans la gestion de la documentation
Capacité à gérer les priorités et bonnes aptitudes en résolution de problèmes
POURQUOI TE JOINDRE À NOUS ?
Poste permanent à temps plein
Tu rejoindras une équipe qui a la volonté de régler les enjeux quotidiens, mais toujours dans le plaisir!
Le meilleur des 2 mondes : les ressources d’une grande entreprise dans une ambiance familiale
Une équipe passionnée, à l’écoute et engagée vers l’excellence
Comme ingénieur, les possibilités de développement et de progression chez Soucy sont nombreuses
On paie ta cotisation à l’Ordre des Ingénieurs
Flexibilité d’horaire qui vous permet de concilier travail et vie personnelle
Assurances collectives (différents plans adaptés à vos besoins)
Régime enregistré d’épargne-retraite avec contribution de l’employeur
Programme d’aide aux employés et à sa famille
Activités sociales
QU’ATTENDS-TU POUR POSTULER ?
On a envie de te connaître et de t'accueillir dans la grande famille Soucy!

Title: Manufacturing Quality Engineer - Markham, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
What we offer:
Veoneer is the world’s largest pure-play company focused on Safety Electronics, Advanced Driving Assistance Systems (ADAS), Collaborative and Automated Driving (AD). We design, compile and sell state-of-the-art software, hardware and systems for active safety, autonomous driving, occupant protection and brake control. We are 9,200 people working as a team with cutting-edge technologies — like vision systems, radar, lidar, night vision, electronic controls, and humanmachine interface. Veoneer Canada, Inc. is looking for a dynamic individual to join our team as a Product Quality Engineer. The successful candidate for this position will be responsible for leading activities to improve assembly equipment performance and manage assembly process setups. Within this role, you will be expected to drive the business forward, streamline the operation and engage in continuous improvement.
What you'll do:
Responsible for implementing current model product changes. Assess the change’s impacts, manage production trial runs, and lead validations for all product changes such as: supplier/component changes, customer-initiated changes and design changes/continuous improvements. Ensure the change is launched on time and with minimized quality risk.
Develop and validate PPAP documentation in a timely and quality manner.
Product change management: using tools such as APQP, FMEA, Control Plan and associated Veoneer programs to ensure quality in pre-production planning.
Manage and validate prototype builds and prototype shipments to customer. Ensure quality check of prototype shipments to prevent NCE-Prototype, and ensure on time delivery of prototype shipment.
Lead to address critical production quality issues: coordinate the root cause investigations, implement the containments, and drive corrective/preventive actions.
Analyze/correct customer manufacturing concerns using 8D methodology in coordination with customer quality.
Lead PFMEA Go/See/Fix activity and follow up the implementation of corrective actions across the plant.
Participate in plant quality activities like Zero Defect program, etc.
Participate in continuous improvement activities to reduce scrap.
Other duties as assigned.
What you'll bring:
Electrical or Mechanical Engineering Degree.
2-3 years Engineering experience in manufacturing.
Working knowledge of Quality tools and documentation including 8D, PFMEA, Control Plan.
Thorough understanding of electronics assembly process.
Strong leadership and interpersonal skills.
Strong analytical and communication skills (verbal and written).

Title: Mechanical Engineer - Kitchener, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Job Overview
SomaDetect is a high-growth technology startup in the dairy industry that is looking to hire a mechanical engineer. We have a diverse team that strives to develop fiercely innovative solutions, with a focus on quality to create products that put farmers first. SomaDetect is now a fully remote company, with team clusters in Buffalo, NY, and across Canada (southern Ontario, Ottawa, Fredericton, and Halifax), though Ideally this role is based out of Western New York. The Mechanical Engineer is responsible for supporting the development and production of SomaDetect systems, including commercial offerings, R&D Support, and test equipment. This is done through the creation of design specifications, development of hardware designs, documentation of designs, and support of production efforts. Improving the commercial maturity of existing systems through optimization and design for manufacturability will be a significant portion of this role. However, this role will also involve the development of new innovative systems for new segments of the market.
Responsibilities and Duties
Work closely with members of the product development team to reduce cost and maintain quality for the current products through the development of Design for Manufacturability revisions
Work closely with members of the product development team to plan, conceptualize, and develop new product designs (especially the development of the new sensor system)
Generate prototypes to support testing, requirements creation, and customer demonstration
Develop testing and design validation processes, and support or perform these tests/processes
Maintain CAD models, technical documentation, and test procedures to communication production requirements to suppliers and contract manufacturers
Work with domestic and international suppliers to develop and support product development
Specify and evaluate supplier components, subsystems, and services
Keep detailed documentation to track project development and design process
Ensure the project timeline is met and stays within budget
Qualifications
Minimum of 3 years of dedicated engineering experience in the development and production of commercial goods, including experience with injection molded parts and plastic assembly
Experience with product modeling to support commercial manufacturing, ideally with SolidWorks and SolidWorks PDM (commercial experience is more important than SolidWorks knowledge)
Experience with product testing for functionality and regulatory compliance, including development and execution of test procedures
Firm grasp of engineering concepts, and experience designing mechanical systems and products
Comfortable working with remote teams and tools, ideally with Google Suite and Atlassian Suite
Minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering or related field
Experience with Quality Management Systems and Regulatory Compliance is an asset
Experience designing for harsh environments and familiarity with agricultural industries are assets
Must be comfortable in a fast-moving, high-energy, and evolving development environment
Working Conditions
This position will require some travel to client farms, suppliers etc...The role requires some schedule flexibility; availability on some nights and weekends to accommodate different time zones, testing schedules, and travel requirements will be needed on occasion.
SomaDetect is committed to creating an inclusive environment and building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We value diversity and recognize that experience comes in many forms and skills are transferable. If you feel passionate about our efforts and believe that you have the skills to contribute and lead in this role, apply! Individual accommodations due to a disability are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
We thank all interested applicants; however, only applicants under consideration will be contacted.
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Junior Project Engineer - Winnipeg, MB - Indeed.com
Description:
Cronos Group is an innovative global cannabinoid company with international production and distribution across five continents. Cronos Group is committed to building disruptive intellectual property by advancing cannabis research, technology and product development. With a passion to responsibly elevate the consumer experience, Cronos Group is building an iconic brand portfolio. Cronos Group’s portfolio includes PEACE NATURALS™, a global health and wellness platform, two adult-use brands, COVE™ and Spinach™, and two hemp-derived CBD brands, Lord Jones™ and Happy Dance™.
At Cronos Group, we hire talented people who thrive on solving difficult problems and give them the opportunity to hone new skills and approaches. If you want to play a part in shaping an innovative industry and help build a historically significant company, we want to meet you.
If you enjoy a challenge, like to take on different and unique projects, want a career in the food industry, then this is the job for you! As the Junior Project Engineer you will be working with the facility to plan and develop projects for productivity improvement, Providing technical support for the design, procurement, installation and qualification of facilities and equipment including applicable documentation (SOP’s, specifications, drawings, P&IDs etc.), and Collaborate with facility management to define technical needs and CapEx requirements, recommend CapEx projects, etc. The ideal candidate is energetic, collaborative, and forward- thinking.
This position is based out of Winnipeg , Manitoba and reports to the Manager, Project Engineering & Maintenance.
What you’ll be doing:
Develop and maintain equipment and facility drawings, P&IDs and Bills of Materials to document production equipment and facilities
Prepare and route Change Controls as needed to document equipment/facilities/documentation changes
Assist in the development, execution and maintenance of Design, Installation, Operational and Performance Qualifications of equipment and facilities
Assist in development and maintenance of Standard Operating Procedures and Work Order Maintenance Procedures
Assist in sourcing of parts and equipment and creation of recommended spare parts lists for equipment
Assist in performance of experiments, equipment design calculations, data collection and analysis, technical research and regulatory/code investigation
Work with the facility to plan and develop projects for productivity improvement related to Productivity, Quality, Safety, and/or the Environment
Develops conceptual facility and equipment layouts support project engineering activity
Identify, promote, and coordinate implementation of best practices across the facility and assist with problem-solving and troubleshooting operational problems
Provide technical support and troubleshooting support for facilities, equipment and processes including identifying and executing corrective/preventative action plans as needed
Work with the facility to prioritize and optimize ‘Key Performance Indicators” (KPI)
Performs small projects/tasks including material/equipment sourcing, installation and commissioning as assigned
Collaborate with facility management to define technical needs and CapEx requirements, recommend CapEx projects, evaluate CapEx proposals for technical viability, and assist with development of the project presentations
Assist in the validation of equipment, systems and facility to meet cGMP requirements. This includes the updates, review and filing of Engineering documentation
Perform all work in compliance with our Code of Conduct and Business Ethics, and all established regulatory, compliance and safety requirements
Interface effectively with other departments such as production, safety & environmental, engineering, maintenance, QA/QC, and procurement to assist with optimal execution of business needs
Performs all other routine duties when assigned
Your Environment: (for production specific roles only)
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally exposed to moving mechanical parts; high, precarious places; risk of electrical shock; and cannabinoid production processes.
Desk is in an office environment. Job entails many visits to the plant where the noise level is usually moderate.
You’ll need to have:
B.Sc. in Engineering.
0-2 years experience as an EIT Engineer In Training
Eligible for registration as a Professional Engineer in the Province of Manitoba with APEGM.
Excellent communication skills and ability to work in a team environment.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Strong planning and organizational skills for project co-ordination
Strong problem-solving skills
Able to reach and interpret technical information in written, oral or diagram form using various sources including internet, technical libraries, supplier contacts, equipment manuals etc.
Familiar with; AutoCAD, Microsoft Office programs, and MS Project.
Must be able to provide clear criminal record check
We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment, and we welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities and people with diverse backgrounds, identities, and cultures. For candidates with disabilities, accommodations are available upon request in all phases of the selection process.
#LI-KR1
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Senior Civil Engineer - Fredericton, NB - Indeed.com
Description:
Are you looking for an opportunity to …
Be a key part of a growing team?
Work with a group of highly motivated professionals?
Be mentored and mentor others?
Leave a positive impact on the environment and communities?
Develop your critical thinking skills?
Solve some of the most complex problems faced by the mining industry?
Thrive in a fast-paced environment, with high expectations for quality and technical excellence?
Develop a career that provides a mix of field and office time, with potential opportunities for international travel?
Intrigued? Read on - the details of your next career adventure are below.
What makes us stand out?
Aren’t all consultancies the same? We don’t think so. Our tag line “Down to Earth / Up to the Challenge” says a lot about who we are. In broad terms we think KCB’s primary differentiators are:
our global reputation for technical excellence;
appetite to tackle problems with unique complexities;
real access to some of the sectors most amazing talent;
our size (we’re a mid-sized consultancy);
the breadth of our multi-disciplinary services; and
our offices in some of the worlds most beautiful locations.
The right fit – it’s got to be mutual
We recognize that making a career move is a significant personal decision and, from our perspective, building a team of like-minded individuals is an important element to our success. Cards on the table - we are looking for motivated individuals who have: collaborated within multi-disciplinary project teams for the delivery of construction projects; developed and mentored others in construction management and quality assurance; delivered high-quality geotechnical services; and built and sustained excellent client relationships.
KCB Fredericton is looking for people with more than 10 years of civil engineering experience who want to be part of a highly motivated group that works with clients to achieve their objectives, while leaving a positive impact on the environment and local communities.
We are specifically looking for someone who has:
collaborated within multi-disciplinary project teams for the delivery of construction projects;
led teams focused on civil designs which are constructible, efficient, and safe;
actively been involved in dam safety inspection, review, or the development of dam safety systems;
developed and mentored others in construction management and quality assurance;
guided others in the application of critical thinking; and
built and sustained excellent client relationships
Our focus is on the application of critical thinking to the management of mine waste and water and our clients are some of the largest mining companies in the world. The right candidate will show flexibility and be energized by the prospect of working on sites all around the world. Registration as a Professional Engineer in New Brunswick, or eligibility to register, is a prerequisite.
Join us and you’ll find we really DO value your mining and tailings management knowledge, project management skills and experience.
To learn more, check out KCB’s website and our Careers page for more details.
Are you up to the challenge?
If this sounds like the perfect opportunity for you, simply apply on-line with your résumé quoting the job reference number 1683-M21.
We support, accommodate and are committed to employment equity and encourage applications from all qualified career seekers. We thank all candidates for applying, however only short-listed candidates will be contacted for an interview.

Title: Marine Engineer - International - St. John's, NL - Indeed.com
Description:
CURRENTLY HIRING FOR TEMPORARY ASSIGNMENTS!
DEPARTMENT
: Maintenance
JOB SUMMARY:
Maintenance and repair of mechanical, pneumatic and hydraulic equipment onboard the vessel.
PREREQUISITES/QUALIFICATIONS
:
2+ years previous experience on an offshore drilling rig
Valid Canadian 4th Class Engineer Unlimited Licence or Higher (or STCW equivalent)
Valid Basic Survival Training or BOSIET
STCW Basic Safety Training, Proficiency in Survival Craft, Advanced Fire Fighting, First Aid
High school diploma or equivalent
Medical (CAPP or OGUK)
STCW Security Training for Personnel with Security Responsibilities
Valid Passport
Knowledge of all technical calculations required for the mechanical operations
Must pass Physical, Drug Screen and Background /Pre-Employment Screening Checks.
International Travel is required
DUTIES:
Coordinate and ensure that all mechanical, pneumatic and hydraulic equipment maintenance and repair is done in a safe and prudent manner
Ensure compliance to Company policies, local and international regulations relating to the operation of the rig, and current pollution regulations
Monitor the power plants controls and power distribution; ensure that power is available at all times
Ensure that the permit to work system is in place and followed
Participate in the effective management of the Rig Maintenance System (RMS) and ensure all records are maintained on a timely basis
Operate, maintain and repair as necessary the engine cooling water system, lube oil system, and fuel system
Maintenance and repair of all pumps and valves of the ballast system, thrusters, associated driven pumps and auxiliary equipment
Liaise with the marine department regarding the loading, ordering an use of fuel, potable water, and drill water in consideration of the rig’s stability
Plan equipment periodic maintenance and prepare reports for repair and maintenance
Ensure all third-party equipment is fit for purpose, certified, correctly installed, and maintained while on the rig
Maintain an adequate supply of spares to fulfill maintenance requirements and facilitate a safe and efficient operation
Inform supervisor of any technical problems or limitations that may affect the safe operation of the rig
Communicate equipment problems or breakdown information via direct supervisor to Field Support Group
Demonstrate commitment to the Company’s safety policies through the consistent execution of leadership and guidance
Ensure compliance with regulatory requirement for environmental protection
Actively participate in weekly safety meetings and pre-job meetings as required
Mentor, develop and train new crew members
Other duties as required.
It is the objective of Puglisevich to ensure employment equity within the workplace. We encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, visible minorities, women, and persons with disabilities having the capability, qualifications and experience to make application for this position. Qualified residents of the province of Newfoundland and Labrador will be given first consideration in the staffing of these positions.

Title: Junior Design Engineer / Drafter - Saint-Laurent, QC - Indeed.com
Test and Validation Engineer - Drummondville, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
WHAT TO EXPECT
If, when you think of your dream job in engineering, you imagine:
A position with an advanced technical component, without you having to sit at your desk all the time
That you can continue to use your manual skills by getting out in the field
Have the opportunity to develop tests for complex mechanical products
This job exists, it's the physical test engineer at Soucy!
In this position, you will have to manage improvement projects for our test equipment, participate in the development of test plans as much in the choice of equipment as in the development of protocols and support our technicians and mechanics in the realization of their tests.
Here's an overview of your tasks:
Participate in the mechanical design of test benches and instruments
Operate our test benches, do the mechanical follow-up and propose improvements
Support, as needed, the testing of new products at the customer's site as well as at the factory
Write test reports, analyze results and make recommendations to engineering
Develop and standardize product testing and validation protocols
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
You have a Bachelor's degree in mechanical engineering
You have one to three years of work experience (internships count by the way!)
You are fluent in both French and English
In your spare time, you'd be the kind of person to take your car engine apart, just for fun!
If you know a lot about agriculture or motorsports, you clearly win points!
WHAT WE HAVE TO OFFER
Permanent, full-time position
You'll be joining a team that's committed to solving day-to-day issues, but always in a pleasant work environment!
The best of both worlds: the resources of a large company and a family-like atmosphere
A team that is passionate, attentive and committed to excellence
We pay your Ordres des ingénieurs du Québec membership dues
Flexible schedules that allow you to balance your work and your personal life
Group insurance (different plans adapted to your needs)
Registered Retirement Savings Plan with employer contributions
Employee and family assistance program
Social activities.
APPLY NOW!
We look forward to getting to know you and to welcoming you to our big Soucy family!

Title: Engineer in Training, Highway - Woodbridge, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
McIntosh Perry is growing to meet demand – and we need you! As a growing multi-disciplinary engineering and related professional services firm, we are building on our strong National reputation by maintaining our commitment to ethical work practices, a quality product and exceptional service. With more than 600 employees in offices across Canada, McIntosh Perry is expanding its scope and looking for new talent to join our supportive, dynamic team. Our core values validate everything we have believed in since our company started:
Walk a mile in someone else’s shoes
- Treat others as they would like to be treated
Make Momma proud
- Do the right thing
Every McIntosh has a core -
Be a leader
Pass. Shoot. Score.
- Becoming excellent together
Did you dot the i’s and cross the t’s?
- Personal responsibility
Don’t forget to cut the ribbon
- Making a difference
If you are looking for an opportunity to work with a collaborative, hard-working and dedicated team of professionals and have fun, then this could be the right opportunity for you.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
We are seeking EITs to join our offices in North Bay, the Greater Toronto and Hamilton Area (GTHA), and Kingston. Living in these locations is preferred, but not required, as McIntosh Perry embraces a flexible work environment. Occasional travel to the relevant office will be required.
The successful candidate will use their knowledge, skills, and abilities to support senior team members in highway design contract delivery by:
Collecting and maintaining project documentation;
Attending field reviews with senior staff;
Assisting with the development of preliminary and detailed engineering drawings including plans, profiles, and cross-sections;
Assisting with preparing specifications, contract tender documents, and tender quantities;
Assisting in preparing contract temporary and permanent signing and pavement marking drawings; and
Reviewing reports, and preparing meeting minutes.
QUALIFICATIONS
Completion of a university degree in Civil Engineering;
Basic highway engineering principles gained through education or experience
Pursuing licensing as a Professional Engineer in Ontario;
Proficient with Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint;
Proficient with AutoCAD and experience with InRoads/Open Roads would be considered an asset;
Excellent oral and written communication skills in English;
Strong attention to detail, problem solving skills, and time management;
Ability to work effectively as part of a team; and
Possess a valid driver’s license and have access to a vehicle that has valid registration and insurance.
McIntosh Perry is an equal opportunities employer offering a competitive salary and benefits to those with the skills suited to the needs of our clients.
McIntosh Perry welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Title: Engineer MW5/SE4 (FM) - White Rock, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Fraser Health Authority is growing, the kind of growth you want to be a part of. With over 25,000 employees, 2,500 physicians and 6,500 volunteers providing a wide range of integrated health care services to over 1.8 million people living in Metro Vancouver and the Fraser Valley, Fraser Health is the largest and fastest growing Health Authority in Canada. We want you to join us in our growth as you maximize, improve and expand your skills.
Facilities Maintenance and Operations provides hospital site-based stewardship of physical assets including structural, mechanical and electrical systems through programs of preventative, predictive and demand maintenance and long-term infrastructure renewal.
We are proud of the innovation, dedication, integrity and tenacity of our physicians, employees and volunteers. More than any building or technology, it's our people who make Fraser Health distinct.
We currently have an exciting opportunity for a
Casual
Maintenance Worker 5/SE4 at
Peace Arch Hospital
in
White Rock, British Columbia!
In this role you will operate and maintain a variety of computerized building automated systems such as:
the facility HVAC systems, emergency power systems and other utilities and;
operational and maintenance duties associated with buildings, equipment furnishings and grounds.
Education and Experience:
4 th Class Power Engineer certificate recognized by the Province of BC
Two (2) years’ recent related experience.
Valued Benefits:
A career at Fraser Health will offer you the opportunity to work in a fast growing and exciting organization with professionals who are eminent in their respective fields. We offer a competitive compensation package, including comprehensive health benefits coverage.
Come work with dedicated professionals who are enthusiastic and committed to provide quality healthcare to our clients/patients/residents. We invite you to find out why more than 95% of new employees recommend Fraser Health as an excellent place to work! Work hard and have fun while you do it!
